intro: Ononis hispanica subsp. mauritii, commonly known as the Mauritius bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to the Canary Islands and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
